response.answer_text: By expressing your question a bit more. Your question is too broad and too vague. You know what would make it better? A little bit of details. That may be the key missing ingredient to the way you express yourself. That you might be lacking details. Instead of painting using only black stick figures you need to use broad brush strokes and use a lot of colors. When someone asks you how your day was, instead of saying "Great", tell them what made it great. Don't be afraid to tap into the emotions you are feeling. Which brings us to your emotions. There are several different words for you to express your emotions and feelings. Take a look. Play with these words. Mix and match them.   You also need to take risks, especially the risk sounding stupid. Often times we hold back what we want to say because we feel others might judge us the wrong way. But this also means that what we express is limited. We really want to be safe, but that is harming us because we are not fully saying or expressing what we think or what we want. If this is you, then learn to say what's on your mind. Doesn't matter if it's right or wrong, funny or not, just open your mouth and say it.

It all starts from childhood when you are developing yourself and trying to find your passion. Creating essays, joke poetry and express your opinion. To my mind, writing speaks louder than words. Each life path is a miracle, each opinion is unique. If you think that all the words were already used and every statement was already said. Think again. No one can be you and no one can gain the same life experience as you did. Maybe someone’s thoughts were similar to yours, but you can add your own opinion to a common saying. Writing can be very therapeutic, you can start a diary or your own blog to find out the real you. I can recommend you to read a book, called The Vein Of Gold by Julia Cameron. The author explains how you can define your true life mission by means of storytelling. If you want to master the art of writing and weave breathtaking articles, the only thing you have to do is practice. There is a challenge for aspiring writers, who want to attract attention to their works. MonsterPost offers a platform with over 1 million readers for you to publish engaging posts. Creators can express themselves and earn $3000 with their pieces. Curious to learn more? The details of a contest can be found on the official page. Monster Content Challenge 2017

Hi ..! Lets understand what expression is. Then we will see what we can do to improve expression power. “Expression means you translate your mind and heart.’’ Expression is very simple. You are in a particular state of mind and heart and that is confined within you and you want to let it out. For that you express. Expression can be in words or in gestures. If someone made me super happy I can express it words by saying ‘ I am happy' or I can simply give a tight hug to that person. How to improve expression? Understand your state of heart and mind first . By this I mean first feel your emotions by yourself and be clear about them.Do not look for right words and just simply let it out and please make sure you are polite enough. You are not supposed to sound offensive. Else it will make others feel that you are not worth listening.Express in the language you are comfortable in. I think I express myself better in hindi and urdu so please find your language.Actions are better when it comes to expression then words. If someone makes you happy , give him/her a tight hug, pass a bright smile then saying that they made you happy.Understand, that it is not a task to express. Its your way of liberating your emotions out of you and this will come with patience.All the best :)

Write poetry and post in places people you n don't know will see there for your letting stuff out that people don't care but at least it's out there and for others to see will give you the benefit of the doubt heres mine and here's how I feel Misunderstood ❌ My mind Is ran by a tyrant fueled by anger given from Trauma stuck under water in a current with no current peace has a peaceful mind he trapped in a box with a million locks and never had the key he's lost in the deep dark sea and can't see a future he screams and shouts but it never comes out he's not frustrated he is misunderstood and scared as the scared little boy he was once before unable to Express his emotions without angering his parents or being a burden he wants others to be happy but moves as a jockey to get what he wants to try and keep his peace but has no peice of mind of what's to come the darkness of the world the coldness of this winter with the life he never wanted to enter forced out the womb with this deadly wound a deep scar on his mind with the question if he'll ever be fine ready to give in with his time giving out he becomes the very thing he once destroyed for others benefits he yearns to learn who his complete self is capable of with the mind of a dove he knows he'll never be loved knowing he's part of a dark and twisted curse he wants his body in a Hurst™️

It really depends on what you mean by the question.  Do you mean creatively, politically, or socially? If you want to express yourself creatively, you should pick an art form you are comfortable with trying and play around with it.  You can keep a journal of your thoughts, and then you might try turning them into a song, poem, or play. You might try listening to music and painting while you focus on the shifting sounds. See if there is a local coffee house that does art shows, poetry readings, or open mic nights when you are ready.  That can be really fun and it enables you to express yourself in a light and fairly stress-free way. If you want to express yourself politically, try to find a group that shares your beliefs and see if you can attend some meetings.  Maybe you could start an internet blog expressing your ideas.  You could also start a local group to discuss your ideas. If you want to express yourself socially, meaning you want to better communicate and interact with people, you need to find opportunities to do this.  See if your local community has a toastmasters club or something to that effect.  Participate in community events where there will be light chatting but not heavy conversation if you are uncomfortable in social settings and want to improve. I know this advice was pretty broad.  I hope that it helped somewhat.Thanks for the A2A.

How people express themselves? Easy! Figure out what you like, and what you want people to know about you, and do it! It can be a bit tough at first to figure out exactly how to express yourself in a way that isn’t over the top, or obnoxious. Eventually who you are and what you enjoy will become a part of your personality, so you don’t have to try to express yourself, it just happens naturally. :) For example, I’m a musician, I love music more deeply than anyone I personally know, because of this, I sing to myself, hum tunes, and tap my foot when there’s no music playing. I never sat down and said “I’m going to do these things because I want people to know I’m a musician”, they’re just so rooted in my personality that they happen anyway. Who you truly are will always rise to the surface, and people will like you for who you are, and what traits you have. Expressing yourself is as automatic as breathing, and blinking. Thank you for the A2A, hope I answered your question. :)

For this, first identify the need. Why do you want to express? For people to understand? For bringing out the emotions? For letting go?If for people, you can use verbal communication while being cautious of what you are saying. Along with this you need to take care of non-verbal communication too like your facial expressions and body language. If it is for letting out your emotions, you have many many options. The most effective one being writing. You can write about anything and everything. You may also talk to yourself in a mirror if the need arises. In this case, I would ask you not to depend on people to lend you an ear. Be your own ear. Hope this helps.

Try everything. Really. Painting, poetry, debating, dance, screenwriting, drawing, knitting, woodwork... everything. Expressing yourself is turning what's in there into something that's out there. To do that you need some kind of a medium. If you try everything, something will light you up. You'll feel it in your fingers, or your voicebox, or your intuition... and ultimately in your heart. You'll know it when you find it, I promise you.

To one degree or another, we all express ourselves. Facial expressions, bodily movement, and vocalizations are common to nearly everybody, even other mammals. Artists manipulate a broad variety of media to elicit emotional response. The most extensive catalog of the world’s languages, generally taken to be as authoritative as any, is that of Ethnologue (published by SIL International), whose detailed classified list as of 2009 included 6,909 distinct languages. I remember reading a story about a soldier who had been kept alive through the loss of all four limbs and his face. He communicated by thumping his body in Morse Code.

Expression is an art and it becomes easier when situation and context support the theme of your expression. Here are some notes which can make expression more effective. Choose the right person. Ensure that he/she is really interested in your talks.Before speaking out ensure that he/she is not preoccupied with other things.Be very clear which trait of yours you actually want to express. It can be your strength or weaknessChoose to narrate a real life incident which highlights​ identified traits.While narrating be consized covering key ideas. Dont go into unnecessary minute details.Involve listener in your talk. Ask questions like what they would have done if they been in that situation.While speaking be patient and pass smile when needed.Choose right place and time.Maintain eye contact while speaking.Try to start your conversation with interesting note. May be humourous, surprise.Hope it help you.

May be by writing it down on a piece of paper because it's easy to express our emotions in writing.You could always write something creative about yourself in your bio or status or on whichever social networking platform that you are using.You could personally go to that person when he/she is alone and accordingly express yourself.You could also ask a trusted mutual friend to express your feelings to that person.I would say have confidence and if you are having a strong intuition that it's going to be great then go up to that person and express yourself.

How to express yourself  I love to wear any type of clothing that’s loud and bright. By expressing yourself, that means being yourself. It means being unique, setting your own trends and not following others. You can stand out from the crowd without having to look like other people. What makes you, you? What’s your hobby? You have to find what you love and rock it with the upmost confidence. For me, expressing myself means wearing what the hell I like and having no time for judgmental people. You can also take up something like art, creative drawing or do something that says that is you, that’s your book mark.

People whom are in touch with there emotions can thus know their feelings,but even emotionally intelligent people can become confused. That's just it though. Confusion shldnt be frowned upon,or being unable to feel.. There are a lot of people that feel&feel a lot!! They just don't know how to express their feelings -formulate them put them into words. There's like this block I imagine. For various reasons ,but I am coming to realize just how frustrating this really must be.. Some people feel too much and this can be detrimental cause it just internalizes &festers within. Same with person who suppresses either purposefully ,or unintentional.. There's feeling charts -words that can help a person but they have to be willing&serious abt wanting this. Some have just surrendered as its too insurmountable for reasons they themselves only know.
Get good ideas, learn from whatever you can. Suggested to visit ted.comLearn many things. Focus on what you can do in life the way nobody can.Expressing yourself will become natural.
Find your method of conveying yourself, just experiment with different things. Search online for a description of yourself and then add how can I express myself at the end.
Freely at times, cautiously at other times, and not at all if you have nothing to add.
